title.value: Signatures of Co-evolution and Co-regulation in the CYP3A and CYP4F Genes in Humans
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the beginning of the paper, indicating the main focus of the research.
title.quote: Signatures of Co-evolution and Co-regulation in the CYP3A and CYP4F Genes in Humans

extractions.description: This paper studies the genetic diversity and selective pressures in human populations focusing on the CYP3A and CYP4F gene clusters. It uses datasets from the 1000 Genomes Project to identify co-evolution and co-regulation signatures, highlighting the genetic differentiation and evolutionary forces at play within these gene families.

type.justification: The paper conducts a theoretical analysis of genetic data to determine signatures of co-evolution and co-regulation.
type.quote: In this study, we investigate the genetic diversity of CYP450 genes. We found that two clusters, CYP3A and CYP4F, are notably differentiated across human populations with evidence for selective pressures acting on both clusters.

name.justification: The research focuses on genetic diversity, evolution, and gene regulation within human populations, which falls under the domain of genomics.
name.quote: Cytochromes P450 (CYP450) are hemoproteins generally involved in the detoxification of the body of xenobiotic molecules.

name.justification: The paper explores genetic diversity and selective pressures across human populations, fitting within the field of population genetics.
name.quote: In this study, we investigate the genetic diversity of CYP450 genes across human populations.

name.justification: The dataset is repeatedly mentioned as the source of the genetic data analyzed in the study.
name.quote: We obtained genotypic data from the 1000 Genomes project phase 3 release (1000G).

referenced_paper_title.value: A global reference for human genetic variation
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is a landmark paper for the 1000 Genomes Project, providing context and background for the data used.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We obtained genotypic data from the 1000 Genomes project phase 3 release (1000G) (Genomes Project Consortium et al. 2015).
